pullRequest.title: [ML] Delete DF analytics stats upon job deletion
pullRequest.bodyText:
Since a data frame analytics job may have associated docs
in the .ml-stats-* indices, when the job is deleted we
should delete those docs too.

commit.message:
[ML] Delete DF analytics stats upon job deletion

Since a data frame analytics job may have associated docs
in the .ml-stats-* indices, when the job is deleted we
should delete those docs too.

nodes.bodyText: Oddly this returns 0 hits when run with security. I can't see any difference between the .ml-stats and the .ml-state indices. The same search is done for the latter just before and it works fine. I tried adding the header and that fixes it. But it's not needed when searching the state index. Any ideas @droberts195 ?
nodes.diffHunk:
@@ -997,6 +1019,21 @@ setup:
 
   - match: { hits.total.value: 2 }
 
+  - do:
+      search:
+        index: .ml-stats-*
+        body:
+          size: 0
+          query:
+            bool:
+              filter:
+                ids:
+                  values:
+                    - "delete_foo_stats_1"
+                    - "delete_foo_stats_2"
+
+  - match: { hits.total.value: 2 }

nodes.bodyText:
There is some difference between security and no-security cases when it comes to hidden indices wildcard expansion.
Having said that, I don't understand the difference between .ml-state* and .ml-stats-* as both are hidden...
